titleStmt.title: The German history continued. The seventh part. Wherein is conteyned the principall passages of the last summer. ... With the siege and taking of Regenspurg, as also the siege and battell of Norlingen, with an exact mappe thereof. Lastly is added certaine misselanies of stories of most parts of Christendome. All which is done not by the former, but another author
titleStmt.author: N. C.
Watts, William, 1590?-1649. Swedish intelligencer.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Thomas Harper, Miles Flesher, Elizabeth Allde? and John Dawson] for Nathaniel Butter and Nicholas Bourne,

notesStmt.note: The seventh part of "The Swedish intelligencer", the first four parts of which were written by William Watts.
"Harper pr[inted]. A, A[par.]-E[par.], aaa-ccc; Flesher pr. B-K; Eliz. Allde app[arently]. pr. aa*-ee*; Dawson pr. aa-dd"--STC.
"Certaine miscellany relations, or passages .." has separate title page dated 1635, p. ee1r.
The map, engraved with letterpress text, is captioned "A true delineation of the Swedish and imperiall campe near Nordlingen .. 1634".
Identified as STC 11784 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
